title: Best
comment: Best news reader. Only request is please show news in widget at least in two lines, instead of in one line, to get sufficient idea of news quickly like news shown after opening app & one more request is please make +3 size of font in article more bigger than current with options of text alignment. Thanks.

title: To good but...
comment: Too much timed out errors. Fix this and its perfect. Now I have to filter off all the error messages from individual feeds, which is really painstaking. No universal filter either.

title: Best out there
comment: I used to be long time user of Taptu. Dev stopped it and I tried installing many apps like taptu but non of them were good enough. Flym is best of the best. It's even better than taptu.. 👍

title: Thumbs up
comment: Great user experience flow

title: Super awesome.
comment: This is the best app on my phone. Simple, fast, and does the work.  Really great job developers. 👍

title: Great design!
comment: Parallel to this reader I've installed four others with a playstore rating above 4.2, this one looked the best and I've deinstalled the others. I did not find out how to import the .opml from my pc. Export works though.

title: PERFECT!!!
comment: Thank you very much devs!
Love it!

title: On the right track
comment: Simple yet powerful app. Needs a few tweaks to improve. For example, i see no option available to remove a particular news feed source. Also, its using too much CPU. Need to fix these to improve the user experience.

title: Love it
comment: Best RSS reader

title: Great reader
comment: Great for reading feeds. Couldn't work with the filters though.

title: The best RSS reader around
comment: Simple, minimal and easy to set up and use. Personally, I would like to have the option to disable icons in the article list. Other that that no complaints.

title: Glad to see recent improvements!
comment: I'm bumping my review up to five stars because I've noticed that the dev is actively squashing bugs. Although I would like the ability to refresh articles automatically at a preset time every morning. Also, when I retrieve the full text of an article, the loading animation won't stop until I hit the back button and re-enter the article.

title: Best reader I've come across
comment: I have been using rss readers for some years and when the last one was updated to something that was annoying I grudgingly uninstalled then started the search for something simple to use to match what I had. Stumbled on this and wish that I had found it earlier   :)

title: Great app with filters.
comment: Nice to be able to filter out nuisance items in rss feeds. This is the only rss reader I could find with a filter.

title: Cloud flare problem
comment: Thank you for developing this wonderful app. It's not fetching rss from websites where cloud flare DDoS protection is active.

title: Help to visually impaired
comment: While this is a great app, it could be  a blessing for the visually impaired/senior citizens if the font size could be improved to double of the currently available text size. NOTE: It could be a really humane addition and the visually impaired/ senior citizens can't read newspaper and solely rely on their phone for news. Thanks in advance!

title: News Reader For Grown Ups
comment: No BS straight what you need.  Exactly what I was looking for at least.  Eat RSS like food!!

title: Really nice
comment: Great app.please consider adding material design pull down and circle icon refresh.

title: Great rss reader
comment: Almost perfect. The automatic refresh option is too memory hungry. It shouldn't be a service that keeps running in the background. It should use an alarm to wake itself up after the interval. Then go back to sleep after it updates the feeds and notifies the user.

title: Thanks
comment: Simple design, fast, light and dark theme, can automatically download complete entry (article) with or without pictures, scrollable widget. Moreover it is open-source. Only drawback is no synchronization.

title: Simplicity and effectivness
comment: Are the best in this add free news and rss reader

title: Works fine if you don't change the feed settings
comment: Been having some proverbs with this, I found the issue. If u add freed without full text, you need to delete it and re-add it to allow full text. Ticking full text once added does not work

title: Comments?!
comment: This is one of the best applications that i have seen! i wonder if it is possible that we can comment and like the articles from within the application, that would be really wonderful! my best wishes for you.

title: Better than feedly
comment: Love the widget. Can't search through my favorited items, though. Thx for adding font options for the widget after my previous review. :-)

title: Great app but!
comment: Great app but I have one gripe. It keeps showing me articles that I have read and removed. But they keep coming back. Articles as far as 24 hours back keep reappearing.  I thought I was going crazy at 1st. But im not. 3 stars for now intill it gets fixed or I drop to one star and fine an alternative app

title: Bad design choices in update
comment: You fixed the big icons, now it's all good. I would apreciate an option to disable the icons in the article list but at least now they're the same size like in the other material design apps. Overall, to make this review usefull, I'd say that is a good lightweight RSS reader that works offline, good performance and it's opensource, can't stress this enough, and no adds. It just needs a donate button.

title: Excellent app
comment: No complain.

title: Really great
comment: Exactly what I want with offline access, absolutely awesome

title: Swipe left needs work
comment: Like the new icons, however the swipe left to mark as read is hard for me to do. Sometimes  I can get it to work, but most of the time I can't, especially if it's just one entry for a feed.
A new update is on the way and will hopefully fix the bug you had! Sorry for the inconvenience

title: Light, modern, and ads-free news reader !
comment: The best parts of this app, simplicity, are slowly but surely going south. Right now the continuously sweeping "progress" bar at the top after selecting full text is still awfully annoying, and as of today the new obnoxiously large icon at the left of each listing is just plain silly. Or in curry parlance, WTF?

title: Broken somewhat.
comment: Does not work with xkcd RSS feed. No images shown.

title: UI options
comment: The new icons are HUGE! At least give an option to disable them as it doesn't add anything beyond occupying real estate.

title: lightweight & fast
comment: no frills rss reader. i don't see the need for the icons on the left of the news article. could it be made optional?

title: Quick and useful
comment: reader I use every day. Feeds are preloaded so you can read even when going offline. Update: new list icons annoy on small screens.

title: Excellent reader
comment: Simple and effective.

title: Love it
comment: straight to the point with no cruft. superb!
Very good job man! Only the feeds management is a bit tricky, organizing them in categories is not straightforward

title: Awesome.
comment: Greatest RSS reader ever. Latest update fixed entries list's left offset abscence for me. Thanks to devs.

title: Great
comment: Simple and to the point RSS reader. I love it!

title: Great
comment: Note that Safari RSS and Newsify use your code. I will use this instead.

title: Amazing
comment: I like Flym's simplicity that it has and its features

title: How to delete rss groups and feeds?
comment: I think I tried everything but how can I remove incorrect rss feeds or groups?

title: Excellent!
comment: Does exactly what you want it to! No junk, no hassles, no spam. Great developer!
Nice clean design. I like the fact that you don't have to use a middle man service like Feedly.  Would like to see some customizable options for the appearance such as item thumbnails!

title: Stopped working after the Nov 26 update
comment: Will not pull any feeds. Rebooted. Nothing. Disappointed.
A new update is on the way and will hopefully fix the bug you had! Sorry for the inconvenience

title: Good app
comment: Earned a star back for quick reply and a way to delete messages quickly. Still do not like the new UI. Almost every time I left swipe to delete an item the app closes.
There is still the swipe to left/right gestures to mark an entry as read or favorite. I remove the button because they take a lot of place and because I'll try to display the main image of the feed
Very clean and quick. A feed link and title backup option would be cool

title: Excellent app, keep up the good work
comment: -Customizable -Light -Ad & Bloat Free -Superior Than Similar Apps

title: Looks great
comment: Loads faster than feedly.  Give 5 star after more experience.

title: Great design, but reduced usability
comment: The revised design is great but with usability cost. 1. there is no confirmation for the mark all as read, I've made the mistake  and it marked 90+ feeds as read. 2. Go figure these out of few hundreds read articles, would have helped to be able to mark the last x hours feeds or the last x number of feeds as unread, or undo. 3. To mark a feed as read I am not able to smoothly swipe left, its always ending with a speedy scroll and marking the wrong feed as read it needs a fix, else check boxes worked better.

title: New UI needs improvement
comment: Really love the program and use it heavily.  Only problem is older UI was better, easier to use.  One big issue, the 'Mark all read' check is too close to the 'refresh' icon and there is no confirmation or undo.  I have marked all read by accident several times now.

title: Its good
comment: Update: there should be different retention policies for read and unread items. Also starred items shouldnt be deleted.                Fast, simple, ad free, full screen reading. However there are afew things to be desired. 1-Entries view is not optimized for tablets. It can show the begining text of the entry. 2-Full text articles look weired somtimes e.g. links have too big a font or there is too much space between them. 3-Device's menu button can be used to show the list of feeds on the left. 4-when viewing the entries of a specific feed the back button should take one back to the list of feeds or list of all entries instead of exiting. 5-A way of exporting the list of feeds to another device would be great.
Love the new design! Thanks

title: I Found My News Reader
comment: I'm moving over from iOS and my current mission is to seek out the best apps for the things I tend to do the most. I was feeling pretty sad about the state of RSS readers, the vast majority require third party syncing services. Flym shines bright! Not only is it open source, it looks fantastic, is lightning quick, has a dark theme, and checks/ manages feeds locally on your device, it also doesn't require third party syncing services! Looking forward to catching up on all my feeds using this fantastic app.

title: Pure RSS Goodness!
comment: It's so hard to find an honest-to-pasta RSS client that doesn't shove 3rd party services down your gullet... How did I ever overlook Flym?!  Great app!

title: Best of ALL
comment: The unqualified best reader available.  I love that you don't need to subscribe to a service to use it, the search facility is rich with sources, and I like that I can group/classify my numerous feeds.  Too much to rave about here.

title: Offline
comment: The best feature of this app that makes it different is offline mode
love it! simple and fast.
Super
Great!

title: True black background option, please
comment: ... for Amoled devices, like Pocket has it.

title: Great app but why the new odd name
comment: Great RSS reader for those that want quick local access to the content. Name change won't help newcomers find it though.

title: Works well
comment: Simple interface, supports full text. Feels well made.

title: Initial impression good
comment: Seems light, average speed. No permissions! Get the full feed unlike greader. Thanks. Will move * up or down as used...

title: Great, free-as-in-freedom app
comment: This app has saved me countless hours in every morning.

title: Nice clean news reader
comment: I mainly switched to this reader due to the nice widget it has.  A lot of news readers have a disatrous widget, and that forces you to open up the app more often.  I prefer seeing headlnes on a widget and clicking straight through.  That said, I do wish there was a way to adjust opacity on the widget.  It's just a bit too transparent for my tastes, and that forces me into a dark background.  If I could have two things it would be that and the ability to schedule syncs.  Even though, this is four stars easy, maybe 4+

title: Simple yet elegant
comment: Nice simple app overall. Really impressed. Kudos!

title: Still buggy
comment: I revisit this app from time to time as I like the interface, but it's still buggy..I add feeds and they show 0 items, or they don't update for hours compared to another RSS reader I use. I'd love to switch to this app but it's core functionality is too erratic
Best reader!
A little bit too much cpu consumption, but excellent. Functional, beautiful, ad free, and open source. Love it.

title: Very good
comment: Lightweight, fast and fluid, great alternative to cloud readers because you can set your own sync intervals to get more prompt updates.

title: Simple and effective
comment: Really like the simple UI. All that's missing for me is an auto "mark as read" while scrolling. Magazine view (more picture friendly horizontal scroll) would be icing on the cake.
Simple and functional, everything I needed with a great widget. Only complaint is it's a little involved searching for new feeds to add one by one.

title: Simple!
comment: It's an offline RSS reader and it does exactly that. Perfect.

title: The works
comment: The best RSS app I have ever tried - smooth and fast with a great search function. Can handle a large number of feeds with ease. Many thanks!

title: Great Free RSS App
comment: Excellent RSS reader, and for free! Some feeds don't display correctly sometimes (ie. comments will populate the feed instead of the article) but I suppose it could be an issue with the feed itself. Just wish the widget would be improved to display recent articles correctly with the first few lines of content and ability to mark as read. The app works very well, however.

title: Very nice
comment: Its just do what it shuld do! Thanks

title: Simply the best
comment: The best RSS reader for Android. Also, big plus and thanks for libre distribution (GPL).

title: Excellent. Simple and fast with adequate functionality
comment: Galaxy S4 mini: steady application widget with filter functionality. The widget works well and when reading in app, the summary text is always available and almost immediately the rest of the text can be loaded on demand.

title: Didn't work
comment: I tried searching for multiple feeds, couldn't find any of them. You'd think CNN would have returned something.

title: The Best!
comment: The best off line RSS news feed reader. I tried so many but this one beat them all!

title: Finally some customization!
comment: I've been trying rss readers all evening to find something like netnewswire... I don't want pre-made lists of news or social integration or pretty animations and pictures... just let me organize my opml into groups. This was the first app after 10 or 15 recommended ones that let me easily do that. Thanks!
Very good,  but lack a "mark read all"  button  Edit: found it!
But... There is one ;)

title: Best free RSS
comment: Importing the opml was so easy! Works really well with a simple straightforward interface. And you control when it refreshes so no battery overdrain.

title: Filters for multiple feeds?
comment: There is no way to make filters for multiple feeds? Can I filter feeds just one by one?

title: Better than greedly
comment: Offline reading, easy sharing with twitter and evernote. I can open articles in browser, and best of all no login, just upload your .opml. Someone got it right.

title: Great reader.
comment: But it won't import my Feedly opml file for some reason. I really hope you address this issue.

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome....but its only for tablets. I wish if it its available for mobiles too......

title: Excellent
comment: A little buggy but nevertheless a great reader. Great ui.

title: Best, but it would be great if...
comment: Since I'm using a large phone, 6.4 inch, it would be great if there is option to choose the right hand side for the feeds slide-in menu, that way, I can operate everything with my right hand !!  Thanks for the work !

title: Been looking for a new reader
comment: I am very impressed. This has replaced my previous favorite gReader.  Some suggestions: collapse groups with counts of unread. Change font size of summaries.  Excellent work.
Love the ui, but wish i could log in with theoldreader

title: Killer app and open source
comment: Simply put, this is one of my favorite Android apps. I use it for catching up with the news and various tech related websites. Great interface, intuitive, and open source. Love it.

title: Amazing
comment: it's really cool application, and i really like it! however i have some suggestions, I have a lot of feeds in the application and i put them in groups but in the drawer i really find it hard to scroll through all the feeds! i was wondering if you can also make the groups in the drawer expandable? so that i can close the groups all the way to get to the group i need! thanks in advance :)

title: Download pictures ?
comment: I can't find the download pictures option in settings, please tell me

title: Light and tight
comment: Uninstalled feedly about a minute after launching this. Great offline support, full text fetch that works, clean easy ui. Finally a solid reader with features I want and not full of junk or demanding I set up an account!

title: Nice app
comment: The over all application seems really nice!

title: Can't trust it now
comment: Some feeds keep showing old entries (order of the stick, something positive). Recent version replaces the spinner with a flashing bar that demands way too much attention, and doesn't show new entries, instead adding a button at the top. That button entirely misses the point of not showing it all immediately, as it shoves everything down at an unpredictable time, causing taps to miss. The market thing still needs an option to install older versions. Update that supposedly follows some UI guidelines made the top bar blue, and caused the article list to lie to me. I read three articles, returned to the list, saw the same three marked unread, tapped one - and got an entirely different article. I can only assume there's some broken logic on whether to update the list view.

This new button is really useful when you don't want to "mark as read" some entries which just show up. At the beginning it can be boring, but when you use FeedEx extensively it is really needed I think.

title: Thanks for the new card ui.
comment: New interface design works well and blends in with other Android 4.2 apps. 5 stars.

title: Reliable app
comment: Works great!

title: News Aggregator
comment: Offline! =)

title: Very useful, good interface
comment: Very nice reader. Widget support is good too. Only thing I feel could be improved is sharing - only URL is shared instead of title + URL.
Gud

title: Awesome
comment: This is great! Light and fast, I'm definitely gonna switch from GReader..!  Question : can you add a TITLE text size option in a future update?

title: Makes me feel like an a-hole....
comment: ...for buying gReader=/  Commit to more features and enhancements and I'll gladly donate to give gReader some badly needed competition.  One thing I'd like to see is built-in print to PDF.  I have a workaround, but would like to take advantage of the FeedEx mobilizer as it looks so clean.  Keep developing aggressively, please=)  ALSO, WHERE'S THE DONATE VERSION?

title: Great but could be better
comment: The application is great but the only problem is with the right-to-left language, it gets missed up with those languages. If there is an option in the settings for text direction that would be great and will give 5 stars.

title: Very nice rss reader
comment: I like this very much.dumped rssdaemon for this. I have about 50 urls.its difficult to know when this finishes a full manual refresh and is also slow.pls improve perf a bit.

title: Best FOSS RSS reader
comment: Where did it go justified text? I'm going back to the previous version. UPDATE: could ever pop up an option to choose?  Would a patch be accepted?
Sorry but there was a debate about this and the big majority voted for left aligned text, so I just removed it

title: Simple and Perfect!
comment: I've been looking for something like this for ages. A no-nonsense RSS app that allows you to manually add websites and have an image-free experience. (Great for capped data plans) And all this with a nice UI to boot. Thank you! :D

title: Could not make it work
comment: There are groups for feeds, but didn't find a way to add any feed to group. Tried feeds from 3 blogs (at least 2 hosted on wordpress), but app was not able to show even single post on any of the sites. Just pre-set bbc feed worked. No idea what are the "Article" items from screenshots.

title: Great for the most part
comment: Did everything I wanted rather well. Only problem was with the Hello Internet podcast. Kept getting some error and not loading anything.

title: Erratic feed updating
comment: I really wanted to like this app but feed updating is broken - some lag by hours or just give up entirely. Gone back to Feed Demon until fixed. This problem still exists in 1.5 - Feedex has two articles from today for the BBC, RSSDemon has 80.

Hi! Thanks for your comment.

I just pushed an update which will allow you to reduce the font size. For the back system, it will be a little bit longer.

title: This app went from perfect to freaking fantastic with version 1.5.0
comment: Keep up the good work!
Thanks for your comment ;)

title: Fine, but broken updates
comment: Auto updates are broken in a way that a feed looks like incomplete and only one item gets duplicated and replaces other feed items in which are not shown and lost unless you delete the whole feed and restore it then

Open source. Great for offline reaDing. Great Google/Newspro replacement	I've been looKing for a Google news replacement that grabs rss feeds and saves the entire(not just the rss feed) page's content, minus formaTting and ads. I also needed offLine reaDing.  This is just what i needed.  Even import your old feed list. Very customizable. Been using since the cutoff last July with no coMplaints. Only request is to keep the f-droid build as current as the play store build.

title: Truly offline RSS reader.
comment: Oldschool RSS client. No accounts necessary, completely autonomous client.

title: Good
comment: Widget doesnot refresh to get new entries...  there should be a button for it

title: Ok
comment: Opml import bit confusing cause I have good names for feeds in OPML-file but the FeedEx ignores them and populates feed-list with url address of feeds. But on 1st refresh the FeedEx renames feeds to feed title. Maybe there should be option when importing "use names from file or download title on refresh". Also I would like to have option "on mark all read move to next feed"

title: example product of a good, active, KISS developer
comment: Keep It Simple Stupid.  Not more, not less, than to make it the best at doing one thing and one thing only

title: Best standalone feed reader I've found
comment: Only one slight issue in that the widget doesn't seem to update very often (main app is fine). Aside from that, it's got a nice interface and works very well - especially if you don't want to create yet another user account like most other RSS apps require you to.

title: Excellent App
comment: Good light weight app.  "Retrieve full news" stopped working..:-(  But below options(much needed) can be added.  1. Delete read/unread articles manually. 2. Mark all read 3. Delete all read 4. Above options 3 & 4 for both all entries as well within the group. 5. Articles store in SD card or phone memory.  Thanks, Dinesh

title: Great rss reader
comment: I like current feature like import from feedly, option refresh only in wifi, download picture or disable it.  It would be perfect if it has option to: 1. Thumbnail view, magazine or open all articles (like feedly) 2. Download picture only in wifi  Otherwise, it is great app, no ads or "premium feature", I really appreciate it. Thanks for it :)
Simple , nice reader

title: Thank you
comment: Installed because it's open-source :)

title: Great, Simple RSS Reader
comment: A really nice RSS reader that doesn't try to do too much or get in your way. It just lets me quickly see what's in my feeds.   If you don't need a syncing RSS reader, you should take a look at this one.

title: lightweight and quite useful
comment: I like the ability to download the full page content though it doesn't work very often abd/or there is no way to find out what it is doing (if it still downloads the content)
Concerning the crash I just fixed it you will have an update soon, sorry for this.

title: Beautiful!
comment: Gorgeous display of news articles, simple and fast. Few, very tiny improvements: When a faroo search is made, there is no clear indication where the news articles are from (ie guardian/telegraph?). The feed search button isnt obviously. The format of the text isnt always clear e.g. daily mail.

title: Awesome.
comment: This is one of the best readers on Play store, I mean it. It's free and open source.
One day I will rework the interface for tablet. But it will take some time, so be patient ;)
Best rss reader

title: Excellent!
comment: Small app that does exactly what i need. No clutter, easy to use, configurable. Finally i can get rid of feedly!

title: small - simple - works - free
comment: hope it never gets bloated  - i can skip the pics download by choice, dev is responsive to email, no nosy permissions, besides tweeting this occasionally, where else can we promote this folks?
Thanks for your comment! To be honest I either don't know how to promote it, I'm really not an expert in communication ;) I tried to post on xda forum but there wasn't lot of answer
It's simple but excelent

title: Best RSS reader ever. But old interface is better
comment: Best RSS reader. Simple. Faster. Without sync. I love it so much. Best of the best.  But it will be better if we can also read unupdated blog. For example 10 latest post no mater what time it posted. Cause there is no post available on unupdated blog.   Thanks you so much

title: Very user-friendly and ad free
comment: It also has the benefit of downloading the full text of the feed. Very useful if you do not have a good data plan.

title: Simple, easy to use
comment: By far this is the best rss reader that I have found. It's so simple to use and I like the automatic refresh feature. The widget also looks great.

title: Great app
comment: Refreshingly simple interface. I'd love an option to switch off justified text alignment and get white text in the dark scheme. Full text download for offline use is impressive.

title: Great Google reader replacement
comment: I've been looking for the simple functionality of the Google reader app, mostly the full screen scrollable widget. My only issue is I can't count on the widget to update all the time. And you can't force an update.
I'll improve the widget font size for the next release, a lot of people are asking for it ;)

title: Nicely designed app - simple and effective
comment: Don't expect tons of bloat and flashy graphics... do expect a nice slim rss reader.    Edit - I originally mentioned that the app needed a way to move feeds into newly created groups.  The developer kindly mentioned that this feature is in the 'settings' :-)  I love it.
In the action bar, there is an option for sorting feed, just enable it and drag and drop your feed into the group ;)

title: Love it
comment: Simple, elegant and brilliant

title: Fantastic application.
comment: This light, fast, responsive RSS reader is probalby one of the best FOSS apps for Android.

title: One of the best.
comment: Thanks.

title: Who needs sync? Everybody with phone+tablet.
comment: Update: I understand app developer's situation and yes, more apps can perform the syncing feature I mention about. Bottom line, app does its job extremely well. Will keep an eye on this app, to see how much it keeps evolving. For now, five stars.

I agree some people need synchronization, and there is lot of reader apps for this on the market. I also would like to implement it, but this will take time and I have things to do before... Please understand this

title: ULTIMATE APP
comment: Rating it the best after trying many rss feed readers, although a few more font and customization related options are expected in a future update

title: Bestest!
comment: Great update, thx!

title: Simple & beautiful
comment: Almost perfect! Way better than sparserss, please just improve the feed discovery mecanism, this should be simpler

title: Not a Google Reader replacement for me.
comment: Way tooooi slow when it comes to loading/update feeds. Have been waiting 20 minutes and only loaded about 10% of me news feeds.
The new v1.1.0 version improve the feed fetching speed. It's still possible to do better and I'll work on that, but I hope you'll see an improvement.

title: Excellent
comment: Simple & effective!

title: Not updating feeds from feedburner
comment: Why this app not updating feeds?
This should be working... Can you bring more information about this issue?
